questions.question: What is the correct CSS syntax for making all paragraph elements red?
questions.explanation:
In CSS, to style all elements of a particular type, you simply use the element name as the selector. The p selector targets all

elements on the page.

questions.question: Which property is used to change the background color of an element?
questions.explanation: The background-color property sets the background color of an element. It can accept color names, RGB values, HEX values, and other color formats.

questions.question: How do you select an element with the class name 'header'?
questions.explanation: In CSS, class selectors start with a dot (.). The .header selector will target all elements with class='header'.

questions.question: What is the correct way to apply a style to an element with id 'main'?
questions.explanation: In CSS, ID selectors start with a hash (#). The #main selector will target the element with id='main'. IDs must be unique within a page.

questions.question: Which CSS property controls the text size?
questions.explanation: The font-size property is used to control the size of text. It can accept various units like px, em, rem, %, etc.
